urls.title: AirAsia X Travel Voucher
urls.description: AirAsia X Travel Voucher Frequently Asked Questions 1. Why did I r eceive a travel voucher instead of a cash refund? We are unable to provide a cash refund to guests affected by cancelled flights during the pandemic as part of the legal requirements associated with the debt restructuring process that the airline recently underwent. Please refer below for more details. 2. Which provision of the law prohibits AirAsia X from giving their customers full cash refunds for services not rendered? (1) AirAsia X

urls.title: All you need to know about our cabin baggage policy
urls.description: This policy will be reinstated effective from 7 July 2020. You are allowed to bring onboard two (2) pieces of bag as part of your cabin baggage allowance with the total weight of both items not exceeding 7kg. O ne (1) piece of cabin bag must not exceed 56cm x 36cm x 23cm including the handles, wheels and side pockets. This bag must be able to fit in the overhead compartment in the aircraft cabin. You may also carry one (1) piece of laptop bag, handbag, backpack or any other small bag which must not

urls.title: Are children allowed to travel alone?
urls.description: Children aged below 12 on the day of departure are not allowed to travel alone unless they are accompanied by a person, whom on the day of departure, is at least 18 years old or above. Children must be seated next to the accompanying adult whom they are travelling with. Young Passengers Travelling Alone (YPTA) Children between the age of 12 to below 16 years old on the day of departure are considered as Young Passengers Travelling Alone (YPT A). They must not be seated at the emergency exit row. YPTA

data.text: @Simple_Simperr Hi @Simple_Simperr. Cabin bag must not exceed 56cm x 36cm x 23cm including the handles, wheels and side pockets. This bag must be able to fit in the overhead compartment in the aircraft cabin. Thank you - Jei
